page.title: 18Risley Ordnance Factory
page.content: This factory was opened in l939 to produce bombs.The site was chosen because it was close to towns which could provide a 20,000 work force.The semi-isolated area was ideal for security reasons.The misty,damp mossland reduced the risk of accidents and the mist obscured the site from enemy aircraft.The workers filled the bombs and assembled all the components in the bunkers.In the danger areas no metal was allowed as it could cause a spark.Special uniforms with wooden fastenings and rubber soled shoes were worn.Wedding rings were covered with sticking plaster.The workers changed in the 'dirty' area and their uniforms were cleaned when they returned from the 'clean' area after their shift. Lorry drivers unloaded components in the dirty area and clean workers took them into the bunkers.
